result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Jay Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges by 4/29/2016 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be entered. Bail on deposit to apply.
*Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and child care. Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 11/5/2015 by 5:00 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Jay Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet
11/4/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and child care. Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 11/5/2015 by 5:00 pm. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges by 4/29/2016 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be entered. Bail on deposit to apply. 

Filed, Sentencing Referral Form, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case in court for decision on defense motion. Court ready into the record previous Judge's ruling on the case. Court denied defense motion to dismiss. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties were under the impression that this case was supposed to be scheduled for today.  Case was previously rescheduled to 10/20/15 at 1:30pm in Branch 45. Case adjourned.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney  Nathan Opland-Dobs for Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Colin McGinn in trial in another branch and thus the defense is requesting an adjournment.  State does not object. Court granted the defense request. Court reminded the defendant to follow all conditions of bail. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
STATE'S RESPONSE TO DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO DISMISS.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss due to vagueness of the statutory regimes related to carrying a concealed weapon and the safe transport statute, filed.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests to schedule case for a non evidentiary motion hearing.  Any Defense motion is due no later than 06-29-2015 by 5:00 p.m., and any response from the State is due no later than 07-20-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defendant appears in court at 8:30 am instead of 1:30 pm.  Defense counsel does not have the file in court.  Defense counsel requests case be set for another status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests another status date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense may be issued in filing motions in regarding this matter.  He is requesting time to decide how they will proceed in this matter.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 04-23-2015 at 08:38 am.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant sent to public defenders office to determine eligibility.  Defendant qualifies for public defender representation.  Status conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM008525  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-18-2015
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Defendant Derrick Jay Richardson in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant states he does not was public defender representation. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/20/15 @ 1:30pm
